hackathon-description-text: An interdisciplinary hackathon on Caltech's campus featuring hackers from all around the world!

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Software Engineer @ Google, Working on Survey Platform
Software Engineer @ Facebook, Live Video Team
Software Engineer @ Facebook, Video Encoding Infrastructure Team
Lecturer in Computing and Mathematical Sciences @ Caltech

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: A Surface Pro 4 for every member of the winning team.
Access to Wolfram Development Platform and Wolfram Alpha Pro.
A Sphero Star Wars BB-8 App Controlled Robot for each member of the winning team.
$1500 in cash to be divide amongst the team.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Most Innovative Hack using Synaptics Touchscreen

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Each member on the winning team will receive a $50 Steam Gift Card.
Each member of the winning team will get a Pebble Time Smartwatch.
Each member of the winning team will receive a mini projector.
Each member of the winning team will receive a quadcopter with HD camera.
Each member of the winning team will receive a bluetooth speaker.

Use your tech skills for good and hack online harassment! Build a software solution that can help reduce the frequency and/or severity of online harassment. Members of the winning team receive Hack Harassment Battery Packs!
A $2000 scholarship to Make School's Summer Academy for each member of the winning team.
A $2000 scholarship to Make School's Summer Academy for each member of the winning team.
$1500 in cash to be divided amongst the team.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Most Innovative Hack using Synaptics Fingerprint Sensor

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: An iRobot Roomba 960 for every member of the winning team. Prize guidelines will be distributed on Friday Night, please visit the iRobot Booth.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Use of iRobot Create-2 Robots

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Each member of the first place team get $1000 in Google App Engine Credits and a Google Home. Each member of the second place team gets a Google Swag Bag.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Use of Google App Engine

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Each member of the first place team get $1000 in Google App Engine Credits and a Google Home. Each member of the second place team gets a Google Swag Bag.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Use of Google Cloud ML
Amazon Web Services - Best Use of AWS

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: The winning team will be awarded one onion to share.

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=400 S Holliston Ave, Pasadena, CA 91106, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: How usable is your hack in its current state? Strive to create a functioning project even if it doesn't have a ton of features!
How creative is your hack? Try to approach the problem you are trying to solve from a novel angle!
Is your hack polished? Create a streamlined hack that looks as great as it functions!

hackathon-location-address: 400 S Holliston Ave, Pasadena, CA 91106, USA
